data.text: @sisterhood_karn There were a lot of unmasked people in the cinema in the end. So you made the right decision.

@sisterhood_karn @haurielooper @BFI Lots to do and be and enjoy without congregating at this time. I joined the BFI weeks before pandemic and I've just kept renewing, it's for a good cause :) I'd prolly be fine but I mask up for others and I'll know you lot all the better when we DO meet one day. No big whoop.
@sisterhood_karn @BFI For what it's worth, I think you made the right decision.

@sisterhood_karn @BFI I’d say you are being sensible and safe, covid is far from over and the current approach for ‘live with it’ is dangerous, it didn’t need to be this way, air purifiers should be installed in all public spaces and work places, also mask wearing in settings such as this event

@sisterhood_karn @BFI Don't apologise for looking after for yourself!
In an ideal world everyone else would be looking out for you & others too, as you look out for them - but since we know a fair few are not, this is the rational choice.
Painful, tho. I'm kind of there too 😞
One day 🥺
@JoshAlexCairo @darren_scott I think if I HAD to pick a Doctor Who death... https://t.co/iWndoBmiDA
@sisterhood_karn @BFI Oh no what a shame! Still you’ve got to do what’s best for yourself mentally and physically. Sending big hugs…
@sisterhood_karn TBH I wouldn't risk it either, lots of peeps are being very uncareful with their new found 'freedom' there will always be next time if you not up for it today 😁

@sisterhood_karn @darren_scott I'd risk death for The Parting of the Ways and rely on a cool deux ex machina to get me outta there

Or maybe Heaven Sent, which would be tremendously fitting if I *did* die
